newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Maradona debuts as silent chat show host.
newsitem.headline: Maradona debuts as silent chat show host.

text.p: Soccer star Diego Maradona made his debut as host of a prime time Argentine television chat show Monday but provided little chat.
The 36-year-old former Argentina captain did little more than smile nervously for much of the show, forcing its other host Mauro Viale to rush to his aid and do the talking.
Attempts to get Maradona to converse with guests including his friend pop star Charly Garcia failed to get far and Garcia began to argue with Viale, telling him "television sucks".
Other guests on the programme included a 65-year-old Italian woman with a three-year-old son and a young Colombian man able to repeat what people said to him backwards.
Viale also publicly presented the family of a man who disappeared during Argentina's 1976-1983 military dictatorship with the military document ordering his execution.
Maradona has often expressed a desire to work as a journalist, and nurtures an ambition to interview Cuban leader Fidel Castro.

But his relations with the press have not always been idyllic. In 1994, after returning in disgrace from the World Cup where he was suspended for failing a dope test, he locked himself up at home and fired with an air rifle at reporters who were hounding him.
Maradona said he will co-host the show with Viale three times a week.
